ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.client
Class Client

java.lang.Object
  ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.client.Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
CLIClient, GUIClient, MonitorClient, PhaseOneMonitoringClient, StockClient, TesterClient, TimerStockPublisher, TimerStockSubscriber, WebClient, WebUIClient
public class Client
extends Object

Author:
Bala Maniymaran Created: 2010-07-09 This is universal client that uses a unified communication layer. It can talk to brokers that implements any type of communication protocol (e.g. RMI, socket, etc.) All the future clients must to be extended from this class or use this underneath.

Method Detail

getClientConfig

public ClientConfig getClientConfig()
Returns the configuration object of the client. Depending on the subclass the actual returned object can be subclass of ClientConfig class.

Returns:
the client's configuration object.
See Also:
ClientConfig

shutdown

public void shutdown()
              throws ClientException
Gracefully shuts down the client. Disconnects from all the brokers first.

Throws:
ClientException

getClientID

public String getClientID()
Returns the unique (respective to a connected broker) of the client.

Returns:

setClientID

public void setClientID(String id)
To set the ID of the client. Note the presence of a unique/invariant client ID is important for the correct operation of a client. Therefore, if you are using this method, make sure that you are using it before any of the pub/sub operation is used. To be on the same side, don't use this method if you are not absolutely sure of what you are doing.

Parameters:
id -

getClientDest

public MessageDestination getClientDest()
Returns the MessageDestination of the client which acts as a sign post for pub/sub messages.

Returns:

getDefaultBrokerAddress

public NodeAddress getDefaultBrokerAddress()
Returns the node address of the default broker the client is connected to. Generally, the first broker the client connects to becomes the default broker, unless specified otherwise.

Returns:
See Also:
#setDefaultBrokerAddress(NodeAddress)}

setDefaultBrokerAddress

public void setDefaultBrokerAddress(NodeAddress brokerAddress)
To specify the default broker of the client. When no broker is specified, all pub/sub operations will be carried out through this broker.

Parameters:
brokerAddress -

addMessageQueue

public void addMessageQueue(MessageQueue msgQueue)
Adds a message queue to the message listener. When a pub/sub message is received by the message listener, it duplicates it and provides a copy to all the message queues added to it. Different message queue can implement different functionalities to handle this message.

Parameters:
msgQueue -

getBrokerState

public BrokerState getBrokerState(String brokerURI)
                           throws ClientException
Provided a broker URI, this method returns the associated broker state. The broker state contains the details about the broker connection as well as, depending on the configuration, the adv/sub messages sent to the specified broker.

Parameters:
brokerURI -
Returns:
Throws:
ClientException - If the given broker URI is mal-formatted

public void clearBrokerStates(NodeAddress brokerAddress)

getBrokerConnections

public Map<String,String> getBrokerConnections()
Returns the map of brokerID -> brokerURI of all the existing broker connections. TODO: This method wastes memory because it now maps brokerURI to brokerURI; it got changed on the way; remove this method and use getBrokerURIList() instead

Returns:

getSubscriptions

public Map<String,SubscriptionMessage> getSubscriptions()
                                                 throws ClientException
Returns all the subscription messages the client has sent in the past. This method is operational only when the store_detail_state option is switched ON.

Returns:
Throws:
ClientException - If the client.store_detail_state option is OFF

getCompositeSubscriptions

public Map<String,CompositeSubscriptionMessage> getCompositeSubscriptions()
                                                                   throws ClientException
Returns all the composite subscription messages the client has sent in the past. This method is operational only when the store_detail_state option is switched ON.

Returns:
Throws:
ClientException - If the client.store_detail_state option is OFF

getAdvertisements

public Map<String,AdvertisementMessage> getAdvertisements()
                                                   throws ClientException
Returns all the advertisement messages the client has sent in the past. This method is operational only when the store_detail_state option is switched ON.

Returns:
Throws:
ClientException - If the client.store_detail_state option is OFF

getAvailableCommands

public Set<String> getAvailableCommands()
Returns all the available commands a user can issue through a client's handleCommand(String) method. The returned set depends on the command handlers added to this client. At least the commands enabled by the BaseCommandHandler will be returned by this command, because this command handler is always added to any client by default.

Returns:

getCommandHelp

public String getCommandHelp(String cmd)
Returns the help text for a particular command. For this command to work properly, the command should be supported by one of the command handlers enabled in the client and the command handler who supports this command should also include a help text for that command.

Parameters:
cmd - The command for which help needed.
Returns:
The help text for the specified command, null if the command is not found in any of the command handlers.
See Also:
#addCommandHandler(CommandHandler), {@link CommandHandler}

processMessage

public void processMessage(Message msg)
Whenever a message is received by the message listener, this method is called. The child classes extended from Client can overwrite this method to implement their own functionalities.

Parameters:
msg - The new message received from the communication interface (from Broker.)

getCurrentPub

public Publication getCurrentPub()

checkForReceivedPub

public boolean checkForReceivedPub(Publication pubToCheck)

handleCommand

public CommandResult handleCommand(String commandString)
                            throws ParseException
Runs a particular command via appropriate command handler. The result is returned in the CommandResult data structure.

Parameters:
commandString - The command string to be run. It includes command, its options, and arguments all separated by space. It is upto the relavant command handler to distinguish between comand, options, and arguments.
Returns:
A CommandResult data structure which includes the result of running the command. In case of an error, it as well is stored in the returned data strucute.
Throws:
ParseException
See Also:
CommandResult

connect

public BrokerState connect(String brokerURI)
                    throws ClientException
Connects to a broker with the given URI. The given URI should conform to an accepted communication protocol format.

Parameters:
brokerURI - URI of the broker to connect to.
Returns:
A BrokerState data structure to keep track of the state of the connection and related operation
Throws:
ClientException - In case the given URI is malformated, a connection already exists to the specified broker, or a communication error is occurred.
See Also:
BrokerState, NodeAddress

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
To check whether the client is connected to any broker.

Returns:
true if it is connected to a broker; false otherwise.

connectionIsActive

public boolean connectionIsActive(String brokerURI)
                           throws ClientException
To check whether an active connection exists to a given broker.

Parameters:
brokerURI - The URI of the broker to check for the connection.
Returns:
true is the client is connected to the given broker; false otherwise.
Throws:
ClientException - If the given URI is malformatted.
See Also:
NodeAddress, {@link #connect(String)}

disconnectAll

public String disconnectAll()
Disconnects from all the connected brokers. The client first unsubscribe/unadvertise all the subscriptions/advertisements before disconnecting from brokers.

Returns:
A String message that describes the success/failure of the operation.

disconnect

public BrokerState disconnect(String brokerURI)
                       throws ClientException
Disconnects from the broker with a specific URI. The client first unsubscribe/unadvertise all the subscriptions/advertisements before disconnecting from brokers.

Parameters:
brokerURI - The URI of the broker to disconnect from.
Returns:
The BrokerState assosiated with the broker.
Throws:
ClientException - If the given broker URI is malformatted, no connection exists to the specified broker, or some other communication exception during disconnection.

advertise

public AdvertisementMessage advertise(String advStr,
                                      String brokerURI)
                               throws ClientException,
                                      ParseException
Send an advertisement to a broker. The advertisemnet is given as a String comforming the PADRES message format. The broker is specified with its URI.

Parameters:
advStr - The advertisement string conforming PADRES message format.
brokerURI - The URI of the broker to send the advertisement to.
Returns:
The AdvertisementMessage produced by the given advertisement string. The message ID of the message is returned by the broker.
Throws:
ClientException - Either their is a syntax error the advertisement string or other error during advertisement.
ParseException
See Also:
advertise(Advertisement, String)

advertise

public AdvertisementMessage advertise(Advertisement adv)
                               throws ClientException
Sends an advertisement to the default broker.

Parameters:
adv - The advertisement to be sent. It is an Advertisement object.
Returns:
The AdvertisementMessage produced by the given advertisement. The message ID of the message is returned by the broker.
Throws:
ClientException - An error occurred during advertisement.
See Also:
advertise(Advertisement, String)

advertise

public AdvertisementMessage advertise(Advertisement adv,
                                      String brokerURI)
                               throws ClientException
Sends an advertisement to a given broker.

Parameters:
adv - The advertisement to be sent. It is an Advertisement object.
brokerURI - The URI of the broker to where the advertisement is sent.
Returns:
The AdvertisementMessage produced by the given advertisement. The message ID of the message is returned by the broker.
Throws:
ClientException - If the given URI is malformatted, the client is not connected to the broker, or there is a communication error while sending the advertisement.

subscribe

public SubscriptionMessage subscribe(String subStr,
                                     String brokerURI)
                              throws ClientException,
                                     ParseException
Send a subscription represented by the String subStr to the broker with URI brokerURI.

Parameters:
subStr - Subscription in String format. Check the PADRES message format for the syntax.
brokerURI - The URI of the broker to which the subscription is to be sent.
Returns:
The SubscriptionMessage sent to the broker containing the given subscription.
Throws:
ClientException - If there is a synatx error in the given subscription string or an thrown by the subscribe(Subscription, String) method called by this method.
ParseException

subscribe

public SubscriptionMessage subscribe(Subscription sub)
                              throws ClientException
Send a subscription to the default broker. Calls subscribe(Subscription, String) method internally.

Parameters:
sub - The subscription to be sent.
Returns:
The SubscriptionMessage sent containing the given subscription.
Throws:
ClientException - When the subscribe(Subscription, String) call throws an exception.

subscribe

public SubscriptionMessage subscribe(Subscription sub,
                                     String brokerURI)
                              throws ClientException
Send a subscription to a broker with the given URI. In case the brokerURI is null, the subscription will be sent to the default broker.

Parameters:
sub - The subscription to be sent.
brokerURI - The broker to which the subscription is to be sent.
Returns:
The SubscriptionMessage containing the given subscription.
Throws:
ClientException - Upon the following situations:
  • The client is not connected to the specified broker.
  • Given brokerURI is badly formated.
  • There is an error in sending the subscription message.
